title: Dominic Bradley
text:
Dominic Bradley (<a href="Irish%20Language">Irish</a> "Doiminic Ó Brolcháin" ) is a former <a href="Social%20Democratic%20and%20Labour%20Party">Social Democratic and Labour Party</a> (SDLP) Member of the <a href="Northern%20Ireland%20Assembly">Northern Ireland Assembly</a> for Newry and Armagh. As an MLA, he was the SDLP Spokesperson for Education and for <a href="Gaeilge">the Irish language</a>.
A graduate of <a href="St.%20Paul%27s%20High%20School%2C%20Bessbrook">St. Paul's High School, Bessbrook</a>, Bradley is a teacher from <a href="County%20Armagh">County Armagh</a>. He acted as Director of Elections for <a href="Seamus%20Mallon">Seamus Mallon</a> MP and for the SDLP in the <a href="Newry%20and%20Mourne%20District%20Council">Newry and Mourne District Council</a> area.
Membership:
Bradley is an <a href="Irish%20language">Irish language</a> speaker, and is education editor of the daily newspaper "<a href="L%C3%A1%20Nua">Lá Nua</a>". He writes in Irish for a number of other newspapers. In October 2011, he was sanctioned by speaker for talking too long without asking a question.
Education.
He studied at <a href="Queen%E2%80%99s%20University%2C%20Belfast">Queen’s University, Belfast</a> for a joint honours degree in English Literature and Language. After his degree he stayed on at Belfast and studied for a <a href="Postgraduate%20Certificate%20in%20Education">Postgraduate Certificate in Education</a>. As a mature student he went to the <a href="University%20of%20Ulster">University of Ulster</a> where he studied for and attained a master's degree in Irish Language and Literature.
